@xray_veeo wrote:

ok almost everyone soo far has been wrong do it like this

makeGlobalObject(1111, 2222, 3333, 0, 10);// Furnace

ok the 1’s aree the xcoords-2’s are y coords-3’s are object id-0 and 10 do not touch

item.title: [HELP] Deltascape Adding Objects [HELP] [REP++]
item.dc:creator: @tehscapeee tehscapeee
item.description:
@tehscapeee wrote:

Yeah you’re right.

Look:

makeGlobalObject(2940, 3353, 2109, 0, 10);

2940 would be the X coordinate of your object.
3353 is the Y-coodinate.
0 is teh way its facing (-1, -2, 0, 1, 2 i think)
and the 10 is somehting I’m not sure about. Don’t touch it.

You also have to have a list like this somewhere.:

[code]if(nonWild())
{
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@yel@Safe", 199);
}

        writePlayers();
        NewObjects();
        Deleteobjects();
        Deletewalls();
        OBJECTS();
        println_debug("Loading finished.");
        break;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Deltascape Adding Objects [HELP] [REP++]
item.dc:creator: @gagea6 gagea6
item.description:
@gagea6 wrote:

       makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, ID, 0, 10);

XXXX = x coord;
YYYY = y coord;
ID = object id;

Read full topic

i think it is in client.java here

public void NewObjects() { makeGlobalObject(3509, 9496, 3831, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2974, 3372, 2783, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3353, 2109, 0, 10);

i don’t get any errors or anything after i added them but when im loggin into the server the objects aint there.??
